```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
w <- sample(10:99, 1) # weight (N)
h <- signif(runif(1, 1, 20), 3) # height (m)

ans <- w * h # work (J)
dis <- c(0, w * 9.8 * h)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("%g J", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```

Question
========
How much work does the force of gravity do when a `r fmt(w, 1)`-N object falls a
distance of `r h` m?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
Work is force times distance.
$$W = Fd = (`r fmt(w,1)` \text{ N})(`r fmt(h, 1)` \text{ m}) = `r signif(ans, 3)` \text{ J}$$
